traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 5 篇资料参考There is no so-called "China's Wailing Wall" in an official or positive sense. However, some Western forces with ulterior motives may use this term in a malicious way to try to smear and distort China.In China, the Nanjing Massacre Victims' Name Wall at the Memorial Hall of the Victims in the Nanjing Massacre by Japanese Invaders is often referred to as the "Crying Wall" by the people. It was designed by Qi Kang, an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the dean of the Architectural Design and Research Institute of Southeast University. The wall was established in 1995 and has been continuously engraved with the names of the victims of the Nanjing Massacre, symbolizing the 300,000 compatriots massacred by the Japanese army.
